intro: Centaurea attica subsp. megarensis, commonly known as the Greek knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with erect, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and resilient plant in its native habitat.
